title: Beneath the Score
outcome: Residents uncover proof of vanished dissidents from early BCI trials. Vigils and public outrage force the Council into crisis. The city is destabilized by movements for truth and reconciliation. Community action rises, and BCI’s legacy is put on trial.

events.description: A group of citizens in a Halden Zone uncovers archived data logs revealing forced disappearances of flagged dissidents during BCI’s pilot phase.
Public vigils and demonstrations for the missing are held. Relatives and protesters demand accountability and immediate answers from the Council.
Council emergency meeting devolves into chaos. Directorate denies involvement, Innovators push for system reform, Harmonists break ranks and express remorse.
Support networks and ad hoc justice forums spring up. Residents provide shelter to at-risk individuals out of distrust for BCI. Debates on reparations dominate civic life.
Amid ongoing protests and truth campaigns, calls increase for a full public reckoning over BCI policies, forcing Council to consider suspending or reforming the system under public oversight.
